snippet: The vote, set for Monday, showed how quickly the politics of President Obama’s foreign policy have shifted after he vowed in a speech to the nation to degrade and ultimately destroy ISIS.
abstract: Congress, in rare unity with Pres Obama, is expected to authorize the American military to train Syrian rebels for the fight against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria militants; Speaker John A Boehner, Republican of Ohio, and majority leader Senator Harry Reid, Democrat of Nevada, voice strong support for Obama's appeal, and promise a quick vote.

byline.contributor: Jeremy W. Peters and Ashley Parker contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The vote, set for Monday, showed how quickly the politics of President Obama’s foreign policy have shifted after he vowed in a speech to the nation to degrade and ultimately destroy ISIS.

headline.main: The House, in Rare Unity With Obama, Will Leave the Trail for an ISIS Vote
headline.print_headline: The House, in Rare Unity With Obama, Will Leave the Trail for an ISIS Vote

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
